name: RemoveWindowsAI
description: Force Remove Copilot, Recall and More in Windows 11
readme_summary: This PowerShell script is designed to remove various AI-driven features and components from Windows 11, including Copilot, Recall, and related services. It aims to enhance user experience, privacy, and security by disabling or removing these integrated AI functionalities.
key_features: Disable Registry Keys for AI features (Copilot, Recall, etc.)
Prevent Reinstall of AI Packages via custom Windows Update package
Remove AI Appx Packages (including non-removable ones)
Remove AI Packages from CBS store
Remove AI Files (installers, registry keys, package files)
Disable Rewrite AI Feature in Notepad
primary_use_case: To forcefully remove and disable all integrated AI features and components from Windows 11 to improve user privacy, security, and system performance.
cover_image_prompt: A digital gardener meticulously pruning invasive, glowing vines (representing AI features like Copilot and Recall) from a healthy, vibrant Windows 11 operating system tree. The gardener uses specialized pruning shears labeled 'RemoveWindowsAI' and is carefully removing the AI vines, which are depicted as tangled, data-stream-like tendrils. The tree's leaves are turning a brighter green, symbolizing improved performance and privacy. Small, subtle icons of a lock and a shield appear near the tree's roots, signifying enhanced security. The background is a clean, minimalist digital landscape with soft, focused lighting. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with clear iconography and a clean, modern aesthetic.

name: hours
description: A no-frills time tracking toolkit for command line nerds
readme_summary: Hours is a command-line time tracking toolkit designed for users who prefer a minimalist, keyboard-driven interface. It allows for easy creation and management of tasks, starting and stopping time tracking, and generating plaintext reports and statistics.
key_features: Generating plaintext reports (daily, weekly, custom ranges)
primary_use_case: Effortless time tracking and reporting directly from the command line for personal projects and activities.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent clockmaker in a cozy, dimly lit workshop, meticulously assembling intricate gears and springs that represent individual tasks. Each completed gear is placed onto a larger, growing clock face that symbolizes the accumulation of tracked time. Small, glowing digital particles representing data flow from the gears to the clock face. Subtle UI elements resembling a minimalist terminal interface are visible on a workbench nearby. The overall mood is focused and productive, with warm, inviting lighting. The art style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a focus on clear details and a slightly stylized, modern aesthetic.

name: anime
readme_summary: Anime.js is a lightweight and versatile JavaScript animation library. It provides a simple yet powerful API for creating animations on CSS properties, SVG, DOM attributes, and JavaScript objects.
key_features: Works with CSS properties, SVG, DOM attributes, and JavaScript Objects
primary_use_case: Creating animations for web elements using JavaScript.
cover_image_prompt: A master puppeteer, labeled 'Anime.js', skillfully manipulating strings connected to various web elements: a bouncing ball (representing CSS properties), a transforming shape (SVG), and a fading text (DOM attributes). The puppeteer's hands glow with digital energy, guiding the smooth, fluid movements. In the background, a subtle interface shows code snippets and timelines. The scene is set in a clean, modern workshop with soft, focused lighting, emphasizing the control and precision of the animations. The overall style should be a 3D isometric illustration, conveying a sense of organized complexity and creative control.

name: Handy
description: A free, open source, and extensible speech-to-text application that works completely offline.
readme_summary: Handy is a free, open-source, and extensible desktop application that provides offline speech-to-text transcription. It prioritizes privacy by processing all audio locally, allowing users to speak and have their words transcribed and pasted into any text field without cloud reliance.
key_features: Supports Whisper and Parakeet V3 models
Voice Activity Detection (VAD) for silence filtering
primary_use_case: To provide a private, offline, and customizable speech-to-text solution for desktop users.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, stylized robot with a microphone headset, sitting at a clean desk. The robot is speaking into the microphone, and sound waves are visibly flowing from it into a small, glowing digital 'brain' icon on its chest. From this brain icon, clean lines of text are directly flowing and appearing in a simple text editor window open on the desk. Subtle digital particles emanate from the text editor, indicating output. The background is a minimalist, slightly blurred office environment. The overall mood is efficient and private. The art style is a 3D isometric illustration with soft lighting and a clean, modern color palette, featuring the 'Handy' name subtly integrated into the robot's design.
